CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A novel conjugated polymer of PBDT-TDPP-S was synthesized , which contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain. This kind of side - chain donor - acceptor ( D-A ) polymer exhibited better solution processability , lower HOMO level ( -5.34 eV ) , and more balanced carrier mobility relative to its corresponding mainchain D-A conjugated polymers. Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptor , the resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short - circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% . Bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted significant attention because of their potential for achieving large - area , flexible photovoltaic devices through lowcost solution processing techniques. 1 To date , solar power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) of 10.6% and 9.2% have been demonstrated in the cells with tandem and single junction structures , respectively , representing an important advance in the development of PSCs. 2 Many recent research efforts have been concentrated on the development of donor - acceptor ( D-A ) narrow band gap ( NBG ) polymers with broad absorption spectra. 3 Despite the great success of these D-A polymers in achieving high performance PSCs , further development of novel electron donor polymers is still in urgent need as the donor polymers play a decisive role in determining the device performance. Nowadays , most of the present polymers are in main - chain D-A frame , which may suffer from lower hole mobility due to the influence of acceptor units in the main chain. Aiming at investigating the effects of the D-A framework on device performance , Huang and co-workers proposed a new molecular design strategy toward side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , in which D moieties were employed to construct the main chain and A units were conjugatedly pended onto the D units in the side chain. 4 Compared to the corresponding main - chain D-A polymers , the side - chain ones mainly possesses three advantages. First , the highest occupied molecular orbit ( HOMO ) energy levels of the side - chain polymers can preserve in a deeper position. Second , a two - dimensional - like structural feature renders this class of polymers with better solubility. Finally , there exists an internal charge transfer ( ICT ) behavior from the side - chain D-A structure , which can fine - tune the band gap ( E g ) of the resultant polymers as well as promote an isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain. As a result of these merits , PSCs based on these previously reported side - chain D-A polymers exhibited a maximal PCE of 4.74% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S - a type of conjugated polymer
2. benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene - a donor unit in the main chain of the polymer
3. diketopyrrolopyrrole - an acceptor unit in the side chain of the polymer
4. [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) - an electron acceptor
5. donor-acceptor (D-A) - a type of framework for the polymer
6. narrow band gap (NBG) - a property of certain polymers
7. highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) - a property of the polymer
8. internal charge transfer (ICT) - a behavior of the side-chain D-A structure
9. band gap (Eg) - a property of the polymer

These are the material names that I was able to identify in the given paragraph. Let me know if you have any questions or need further clarification.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S
2. benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene
3. diketopyrrolopyrrole
4. [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM )
5. donor-acceptor (D-A)
6. narrow band gap (NBG)

8. internal charge transfer (ICT)
9. band gap (Eg)

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A novel conjugated polymer of PBDT-TDPP-S was synthesized , which contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain. This kind of side - chain donor - acceptor ( D-A ) polymer exhibited better solution processability , lower HOMO level ( -5.34 eV ) , and more balanced carrier mobility relative to its corresponding mainchain D-A conjugated polymers. Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptor , the resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short - circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% . Bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted significant attention because of their potential for achieving large - area , flexible photovoltaic devices through lowcost solution processing techniques. 1 To date , solar power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) of 10.6% and 9.2% have been demonstrated in the cells with tandem and single junction structures , respectively , representing an important advance in the development of PSCs. 2 Many recent research efforts have been concentrated on the development of donor - acceptor ( D-A ) narrow band gap ( NBG ) polymers with broad absorption spectra. 3 Despite the great success of these D-A polymers in achieving high performance PSCs , further development of novel electron donor polymers is still in urgent need as the donor polymers play a decisive role in determining the device performance. Nowadays , most of the present polymers are in main - chain D-A frame , which may suffer from lower hole mobility due to the influence of acceptor units in the main chain. Aiming at investigating the effects of the D-A framework on device performance , Huang and co-workers proposed a new molecular design strategy toward side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , in which D moieties were employed to construct the main chain and A units were conjugatedly pended onto the D units in the side chain. 4 Compared to the corresponding main - chain D-A polymers , the side - chain ones mainly possesses three advantages. First , the highest occupied molecular orbit ( HOMO ) energy levels of the side - chain polymers can preserve in a deeper position. Second , a two - dimensional - like structural feature renders this class of polymers with better solubility. Finally , there exists an internal charge transfer ( ICT ) behavior from the side - chain D-A structure , which can fine - tune the band gap ( E g ) of the resultant polymers as well as promote an isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain. As a result of these merits , PSCs based on these previously reported side - chain D-A polymers exhibited a maximal PCE of 4.74% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: a type of conjugated polymer with a donor unit of benzo[1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in the main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in the side chain.
2. HOMO level: the highest occupied molecular orbital level of PBDT-TDPP-S, which is -5.34 eV.
3. Carrier mobility: the ability of PBDT-TDPP-S to transport charge carriers, which is more balanced in this polymer compared to its mainchain D-A counterparts.
4. [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM): an electron acceptor used in combination with PBDT-TDPP-S in polymer solar cells.
5. Photovoltaic properties: the ability of the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM solar cells to convert light into electrical energy, which results in a power conversion efficiency of 4.89%.
6. Open-circuit voltage (Voc): the maximum voltage that can be measured across the solar cell when no current is flowing, which is 0.84 V for the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM solar cells.
7. Short-circuit current (Jsc): the maximum current that can be measured across the solar cell when the voltage is zero, which is 10.04 mA cm^-2 for the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM solar cells.
8. Fill factor (FF): a measure of the quality of the solar cell, which is 56.0% for the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM solar cells.
9. Bulk heterojunction (BHJ) polymer solar cells (PSCs): a type of solar cell that consists of a bulk heterojunction between an electron donor and an electron acceptor, which in this case is PBDT-TDPP-S and PC71BM, respectively.
10. Tandem and single junction structures: two different types of solar cell configurations, which have achieved solar power conversion efficiencies of 10.6% and 9.2%, respectively.
11. Donor-acceptor (D-A) narrow band gap (NBG) polymers: a class of polymers that have a narrow band gap and are composed of donor and acceptor units, which are being developed to achieve high performance PSCs.
12. Highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) energy levels: the energy levels of the highest occupied molecular orbitals of the side-chain polymers, which can preserve in a deeper position compared to their main-chain counterparts.
13. Two-dimensional-like structural feature: a structural feature of the side-chain polymers that renders them with better solubility.
14. Internal charge transfer (ICT) behavior: a charge transfer behavior that occurs from the side-chain D-A structure, which can fine-tune the band gap of the resultant polymers and promote isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain.
15. Maximal power conversion efficiency (PCE): the highest power conversion efficiency achieved by PSCs based on previously reported side-chain D-A polymers, which is 4.74%.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. HOMO level (-5.34 eV)
2. Carrier mobility
3. Power conversion efficiency (4.89%)
4. Open-circuit voltage (0.84 V)
5. Short-circuit current (10.04 mA cm^-2)
6. Fill factor (56.0%)
7. Bulk heterojunction (BHJ) polymer solar cells (PSCs)
8. Donor-acceptor (D-A) narrow band gap (NBG) polymers
9. Highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) energy levels
10. Two-dimensional-like structural feature
11. Internal charge transfer (ICT) behavior
12. Maximal power conversion efficiency (PCE) (4.74%)
